message.body: Hey how are you?
Hi
I'm doing well. How are you?
How are you?
How is the weather where you are?
I'm in Pittsburgh. It's hot here.
I'm good thanks! It's hot and humid, like it has been for days... Better than the rain we had been getting though! I'm from upstate NY/lower ADKs by the way.
All of my conversation partners so far have been young male video gamers. I'm an old female professor.
What is DKs?
Haha that's interesting, I'm a male college kid but not much of a gamer. Do you teach at Penn?
Oh. ASKs.
ADKs
Adirondacks?
I teach at Carnegie Mellon in Pittsburgh.
Sorry, the Adirondack mountains. I forget that people outside of NY don't really know what that means
I was an undergrad at Penn a long time ago.
I'm in the same field of research as the people conducting the study.
What are you studying?
Okay fantastic, what subject/department?
I'm a computational linguist.
Oh, and the Adirondacks are a chain of low mountains all less than 5000 ft that cover a lot of northern NY.
What are
You studying?
I figured out what the Adirondaks are. But I had never seen the abbreviation ADK.
What is your major in college?
Still undeclared but looking at a major in Brain & Cognitive Sci, possibly a minor in linguistics
Sounds great! All my degrees are in linguistics.
I'm signing out now but we can still text until tomorrow night.
Hi. We can still text until 9:30.
Have you taken any linguistics courses yet?
Are you a student at MIT?
I'm just asking because you said "Brain and Cognitive Science" and I think MIT has a department by that name.
(1/3) Hello, sorry for not responding earlier, I'm at work right now. I'm actually at Tufts, where it's a concentration in the Psychology major. My favorite
(2/3) course last semester was Language and Mind, a philosophy/linguistics crosslisting that was taught for many years by Daniel Dennett. That class prompted me
(3/3) to think about a linguistics minor.
